page.title: 11Land Reclamation(Ferryhill)
page.content: Some of the land in our area has undergone considerable change in recent years following the decline and closure of hevy industry sites. The main feature in Ferryhill has been the landscaping of the old Dean and Chapter pit-heap following the closure of the colliery in 1965.The pit-heap was levelled,grassed and had quick growing trees such as willow,alder and rowan planted on it. The land is still owned by the NCB but now offers a far pleasanter view than before.The old pit yard has also been renovated and now houses a small haulage complex run by Sedgefield District Council. The old railway line once used to transport coal from the pit has now returned to nature providing a suit- able habitat for a wide range of plant and animal life.
